item.title: Creating a Docker Image and Uploading it to DockerHub
item.description: I created a nginx web-server container winth docker by using a simple dockerfile. FROM nginx EXPOSE 80 COPY _site/ /usr/share/nginx/html Then, create an image via: docker build . -t imagename:imagetag Optional: Running The Image docker run [--name containername] [-p outport:inport] imagename:imagetag Pushing The Image First, tag the image. Registry host is optional if you are using DockerHub. username/repositoryname suffices. docker tag [OPTIONS] IMAGE[:TAG] [REGISTRYHOST/][USERNAME/]NAME[:TAG] Login to your docker registry. Again, server is optinal for dockerhub.

item.title: On Learning
item.description: I love learning things. I could spend my whole life reading and researching stuff and I probably wouldn’t get bored. But that’s not how things get done. You sometimes have to take action and do something with the things you know. That is, there is a trade-off between learning more to make things better and having the actual time to do things. Mongtaigne states in his Essays that the youth (until around 20) is the time to learn and the rest of your life is time to do.

item.title: Docker Basics
item.description: Docker is a containerization tool used to create images to run across different computers. It’s different from a VM because the containers share the same OS. For docker to run, Docker Desktop should be running in the background and WSL2 should be activated (Windows 10). In Windows, a process named vmmem runs in the background with WSL2 and it uses some RAM. This app is the VM in which the containers run.

item.title: Map Sizes In Games
item.description: I’ve always thought that bigger maps are better in games because there are is a bigger world to explore. However, I recently realized that sometimes bigger games didn’t feel big. For example, Just Cause 3 has a gigantic map of 2000km2. However, it doesn’t feel as large as, say GTA SA. Then I realized that mere size is not enough to create a sense of a bigger world. What the games need is variety.

item.title: CRSG Author Module
item.description: Code Review Serious Game Author Module was my summer 2020 internship project. I created a serious game used in teaching the code review process. The serious game looks like this. Resizing is possible. Here you can see the reviews, see hints. Players can see the solutions if they want to give up.

item.title: Learning Hugo

item.title: WebGL 3D Animation
item.description: Source Code I and Sonat Uzun created 3D keyframe animations with WebGL. It is possible to save/load keyframes to create different animations with this program. We created the model using primitives and hierarchy. I’ve created the model using triangle vertices and hierarchy. I didn’t use any modeling program.

item.title: Unity Gyroscope Demo
item.description: Source Code Created a basic roll-a-ball game with Unity. It uses gyroscope sensors of the phone to controll the ball. There are spikes and a hole that can kill you. Falling in a hole can kill you. When the player dies, they see a death message. When the player wins, they see a congratulations message.

item.title: Combining Game
item.description: Source Code This is a Doodle God like game made with Java. You can combine elements to create new elements in the game. It also features a game editor in which you can create your game content such as new elements and recipes. Players can see available elements. Player can selectt an element by clicking on it. By selecting a second element, players can attempt combining them. If the combinati is sucessful, a new element can be unlocked.

item.title: WebGL Ray Tracer
item.description: Source Code Sonat Uzun and I created an interative, procedurally generated ray tracer with WebGL. It can display triangles, spheres and cubes. It has numerous options. Randomized trace order randomizes pixel rendering order. This results in blurry images instead of slow scans. Use texture creates the spheres with a checkers pattern texture. Moving spheres makes the spheres move in a random direction. Add options create a random sized/colored shape in a random location on screen.

item.title: My Favorite Animes
item.description: I listed my favorite animes. They are all great Serial Experiments Lain SEL is a mind bending experience that I don’t want to spoil. It starts like a generic horror/crime anime but It’s far from it. You must watch it if you’re a computer geek. Cowboy Bebop It has a perfect setting and atmosphere. I very much like the world they created in Cowboy Bebop. It’s weakness is it’s low continuity in my opinion.

item.title: My Favorite Movies
item.description: All of these movies have a special place for me. My descriptions will be very short because I don’t want to spoil much. Barry Lyndon This movie is beautiful. I cannot comprehend how this movie was filmed in 1975. And the story was incredibly believeable. Kill Bill Top notch action. And if you’re not watching this because you’re afraid that it’s too gross or violent, just watch it. Pulp Fiction I’m not sure why I like this movie that much.

item.title: My Favorite Games
item.description: I love playing games and here are some of my favorite games. I’m a metroidvania fan so there might too many metroidvania games in this list. The order of games are totally random. Terraria This game is not a simple Minecraft clone. It has the most diverse original content in a game I’ve ever seen. Weapons are never the copy of the older ones. You can always find something new in the game.
